subject: Negotiation
title: Organizational Politics as Negotiation
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Organizational Politics as Negotiation.

hook.text: Every budget meeting, promotion decision, and strategy session is a negotiation â€” most people just don't treat it that way.

buildup.text: Organizations are networks of competing interests. Resources are scarce and everyone negotiates for their share.

discovery.text: Those who map political landscapes and build alliances advance faster than those who rely on merit alone.

twist.text: Ignoring office politics doesn't make you noble. It makes you powerless in decisions that affect your career.

climax.text: Treat internal conversations as negotiations. Understand incentives, build alliances, and frame your requests strategically.

punchline.text: Office politics is just negotiation with people you see every day.

quiz.question: Why shouldn't you ignore office politics?
options: Ignoring it leaves you powerless in decisions affecting your career
